decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to quickly apply pressure to the opponent with aggressive creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Delver of Secrets, backed up by disruption spells like Lightning Bolt, Force of Will, and Daze. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Wasteland and counter spells, while also maintaining card advantage through cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm. The deck also includes Murktide Regent as a powerful threat that can quickly close out games.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to use fast mana acceleration and disruptive creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher early in the game, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and apply pressure. Cards like Chalice of the Void and Wasteland further disrupt the opponent's strategies, while Eye of Ugin helps to search for key Eldrazi creatures. The deck's aggression is supplemented by the ability to control the board and limit the opponent's options.

The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures and spells, utilizing cards like Hydroelectric Specimen and Poxwalkers. By sacrificing these creatures and casting spells like Dread Return and Reanimate, the player can quickly win the game by bringing back key combo pieces like Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes protection with cards like Pact of Negation and disruption with spells like Thoughtseize and Duress. With the ability to potentially win the game on turn one, the deck focuses on creating a powerful graveyard-based combo to secure victory.

The deck aims to quickly cast a series of spells that allow the player to win the game in a single turn by filling their graveyard with creatures, then using cards like Dread Return to bring back a powerful creature and win the game. The deck utilizes cards such as Chrome Mox and Dark Ritual to quickly generate mana, along with cards like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide. The deck also includes key cards like Undercity Informer and Balustrade Spy to fill the graveyard, and Thassa's Oracle as a win condition.

This Boros Aggro Legacy deck focuses on aggressive creature plays, utilizing cards like Broadside Bombardiers, Starfield Shepherd, and Solitude to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes powerful support cards like Swords to Plowshares and Stoneforge Mystic to control the board and provide additional threats. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional cards in the deck and provides value with ETB effects from creatures like Recruiter of the Guard. The deck aims to apply constant pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a quick victory.

This deck utilizes a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and put pressure on the opponent. It focuses on using cards like Wasteland, Swords to Plowshares, and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Stoneforge Mystic, Skyclave Apparition, and Recruiter of the Guard to put pressure on them. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Solitude and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to close out the game quickly. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent while maintaining a strong aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on using Doomsday to set up a winning combination of cards, typically involving Thassa's Oracle and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck includes various ways to dig through the deck quickly, such as Ponder and Brainstorm, as well as disruption like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. It also includes alternate win conditions like Murktide Regent and Roiling Dragonstorm to keep the opponent off balance. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently and protect them long enough to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures like Ignoble Hierarch and Wight of the Reliquary to quickly pressure the opponent, supported by disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Collector Ouphe to disrupt their game plan. Gaea's Cradle is used to generate mana advantage, while Green Sun's Zenith helps search for key creatures. The deck also utilizes lands like Bojuka Bog and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's graveyard or mana base. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on quickly generating mana and cards to cast powerful combo spells. By using rituals and card draw effects, the deck can build up to a explosive turn where it can cast multiple spells in a row, leading to a game-winning combo. Burning Wish allows for versatility in accessing sideboard cards, while Ral, Monsoon Mage and Storm of Memories provide additional card advantage and finishers. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells before they can react, securing victory in the early game.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently generate mana through cards like Dark Ritual, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Lotus Petal, while also utilizing cards like Chrome Mox and Mox Opal. This deck aims to string together multiple spells in a single turn to generate a large storm count, ultimately leading to a game-winning Tendrils of Agony. The deck also includes cards like Brainstorm, Gamble, and Burning Wish to search for key combo pieces and protect the combo with cards like Defense Grid and Veil of Summer.

This deck aims to quickly set up a winning combo using Doomsday to stack the deck in a way that will allow Thassa's Oracle to win the game immediately. The deck runs a high number of cantrips, fast mana, disruption, and protection spells to ensure it can assemble the combo as quickly and safely as possible. The inclusion of cards like Quantum Riddler and Undercity Sewers add resilience and flexibility to the deck, making it a potent and efficient combo deck in the Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The deck utilizes the powerful combo strategy of reanimating big creatures quickly, disrupting the opponent's plans with counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation. The deck also includes card draw and selection with Brainstorm and Ponder to find key combo pieces. Archon of Cruelty serves as a key reanimation target while Tainted Indulgence provides graveyard manipulation. The deck has a flexible mana base with fetch lands and dual lands, along with some utility lands like Wasteland. Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide additional card advantage and disruption in this combo-heavy deck.

The deck focuses on using powerful control elements like counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage through card draw and recursion with Snapcaster Mage. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides further card advantage and utility, while cards like Thundertrap Trainer and Flame of Anor help control the board and protect the player's life total. The deck aims to control the game early on and secure victory through incremental advantage and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Jace, the Mind Sculptor.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Show and Tell with Omniscience to put Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play for a powerful finish. It uses cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to control the board and protect the combo. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The key strategy is to cheat out powerful threats early in the game and overwhelm the opponent before they can respond effectively.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient and powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf. It uses spells like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Thoughtseize to control the game and protect its threats. The deck also includes Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The key strategy is to maintain tempo by staying ahead on board presence and disrupting the opponent's strategy at every opportunity.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble powerful artifact combos using cards like Mystic Forge and Karn, the Great Creator. By utilizing mana acceleration and artifact manipulation, the deck aims to generate overwhelming board presence and control the game state. The inclusion of cards like Manifold Key and Urza's Saga support the combo potential, while cards like Kozilek's Command and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain provide additional utility and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to create a dominant position through the synergy of powerful artifact cards and combo potential.
